title.narrative: The Girls’ Empowerment through Education and Health (ASPIRE) Activity

description.narrative: (Malawi): .USAID/Malawi's ASPIRE: Girl's Empowerment through Education and Health Activity improves reading skills for girls aged 10-19 in upper primary school, for a strong foundation to help them succeed in secondary school. It incorporates PEPFAR, WASH, and Basic Education funding. FY 2016 Activities include: Performing targeted assessments, including an English proficiency assessment for teachers; Training teachers to improve students' advanced reading skills; Coaching primary teachers to implement the new strategies; Providing materials for students to practice their skills; and engaging communities and students in activities that promote a reading culture. Activities will result in improved learning outcomes for girls; enhanced adoption of child-friendly school models; raised awareness of HIV/AIDs and sexual reproductive health rights; increased awareness of WASH issues; and increased community support for girls' education and health in Malawi....

Objectives for Malawi: ASPIRE is designed to specifically address the challenges that girls face in the Malawian Education system. It is a collaborative, co-funded activity between USAID/Malawi’s Education and Health Offices and implemented by Save the Children Federation Inc. that focuses on all primary and secondary schools in the Balaka, Machinga, and Zomba districts. The main goals are to improve the reading skills of girls in upper primary school, increase the adoption of positive sexual and health-care seeking behaviors, and decrease key structural and cultural barriers to girls’ access to schooling.
